meanings.definition: a group of soldiers in the Roman army
meanings.sent1: The manipulars marched in formation on the battlefield.
meanings.sent2: The general organized the manipulars into different units.
meanings.sent3: The manipulars joked around during their training exercises.
meanings.sent4: The manipulars stood like statues, ready for battle.
meanings.sent5: The manipulars' loyalty to their commander was unwavering.

meanings.definition: a type of liturgical vestment worn by Catholic priests
meanings.sent1: The priest put on his manipulars before the church service.
meanings.sent2: The intricate design of the manipulars added beauty to the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The manipulars accidentally got tangled in the priest's robes.
meanings.sent4: The manipulars shimmered in the candlelight, enhancing the priest's attire.
meanings.sent5: The embroidered manipulars symbolized the priest's role in the church.

meanings.definition: a set of tools or instruments used for manipulation or control
meanings.sent1: The scientist used various manipulars to conduct the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The toolbox contained a diverse range of manipulars for different tasks.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to use the manipulars to fix the broken toy.
meanings.sent4: The manipulars in the magician's hands seemed to bend reality itself.
meanings.sent5: The precision of the manipulars allowed for delicate adjustments.
